sentence.Network_en: He was attended, as are all heads of state, by a full panoply of experts.
sentence.Network_cn: 和所有国家元首一样，他身边跟随着各个领域的专家。

sentence.Network_en: But all they had added was the trappings and panoply of applied science.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是他们所增添的一切,不过是实用科学的装饰和甲胄罢了.

sentence.Network_en: In addition, most hunter - gatherer societies today have a panoply of deities.
sentence.Network_cn: 除此之外, 现在社会中的很多狩猎者都很信奉神灵.

list.abs: the full panoply of a Royal funeral., 皇家葬礼的盛大场面.
only when those things were done was the body of Cardinal Lustiger carried inside the cathedral , where Catholic panoply took over .一直到这些仪式全部结束后，红衣主教吕斯蒂杰的遗体才被隆重地移入了教区的大教堂。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'complete protection for spiritual warfare', often with biblical allusion to Eph. 6:11, 13): from French panoplie or modern Latin panoplia 'full armour', from Greek, from pan 'all' + hopla 'arms'

entry.tran: （尤指令人印象深刻的）一整套，全套
entry.def: A panoply of things is a wide range of them, especially one that is considered impressive.

example.ex: He was attended, as are all heads of state, by a full panoply of experts.
example.tran: 和所有国家元首一样，他身边跟随着各个领域的专家。

example.ex: ...the marvellous panoply of exhibitions laid on this year.
example.tran: 今年异彩纷呈的全面展出

auth_sentence.content: Another charm...a panoply, for preserving all persons while bathing from the fangs of the crocodiles.
